byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

abstract: Andrew Caspersen, Wall Street executive who worked for PJT Partners advisory group, is arrested for securities fraud and wire fraud of up to $95 million; authorities contend he used fraudulent investment vehicle and fake emails to dupe unidentified hedge fund foundation; case highlights issue of how much research and checking institutional investors actually do when making investment, and how much of it comes down to personal connection and trust.
lead_paragraph: The $95 million scheme highlights how much research and checking institutional investors actually do when making an investment.

headline.main: Wall Street Scion Is Accused of Faking Investments
headline.print_headline: U.S. Accuses Wall St. Scion in Fraud Case

snippet: The $95 million scheme highlights how much research and checking institutional investors actually do when making an investment.
